q: The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts.  Let it go. It is not serving you.
h:
“The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts. Let it go. It is not serving you.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.
h:
“Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.” —
Unknown

q: The more one judges, the less one loves.
h:
“The more one judges, the less one loves.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
h:
“You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.” —
Stephen King

q: What you seek is seeking you.
h:
“What you seek is seeking you.” —
Rumi

q: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
h:
“Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.
h:
“Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Life is trying things to see if they work.
h:
“Life is trying things to see if they work.” —
Ray Bradbury

q: Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.
h:
“Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: A moving door hinge never corrodes. Flowing water never grows stagnant.
h:
“A moving door hinge never corrodes. Flowing water never grows stagnant.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Your gift is something that you can do innately better than anything else.
h:
“Your gift is something that you can do innately better than anything else.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.
h:
“Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Time is a game played beautifully by children.
h:
“Time is a game played beautifully by children.” —
Heraclitus

q: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
h:
“Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
h:
“Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.” —
Carl Bard

q: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
h:
“The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.” —
Dalai Lama

q: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
h:
“If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Fear of death is fear of surrender to Infinity. Learn to surrender, to exist at Infinity while alive, and fear of death dissolves.
h:
“Fear of death is fear of surrender to Infinity. Learn to surrender, to exist at Infinity while alive, and fear of death dissolves.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: You don't earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day-by-day.
h:
“You don't earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day-by-day.” —
Jeffrey Gitomer

q: The way out is in.
h:
“The way out is in.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.
h:
“Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.” —
Brian Tracy

q: There are no differences but differences of degree between different degrees of difference and no difference.
h:
“There are no differences but differences of degree between different degrees of difference and no difference.” —
William James

q: You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
h:
“You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept. ” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.
h:
“Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.
h:
“To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: When things go wrong, don't go with them.
h:
“When things go wrong, don't go with them.” —
Elvis Presley

q: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
h:
“Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.
h:
“Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.” —
Voltaire

q: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
h:
“Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.” —
Brian Tracy

q: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
h:
“You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!” —
John Lennon

q: Look to the beauty of this day, miracles are all around you.
h:
“Look to the beauty of this day, miracles are all around you.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge.
h:
“Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: It is easy to love your friend, but sometimes the hardest lesson to learn is to love your enemy.
h:
“It is easy to love your friend, but sometimes the hardest lesson to learn is to love your enemy.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
h:
“Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.
h:
“The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Never give way to laziness.
h:
“Never give way to laziness.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Wherever you are, and whatever you do, be in love.
h:
“Wherever you are, and whatever you do, be in love.” —
Rumi

q: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
h:
“Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.” —
Zhuangzi

q: People who belittle people, will be LITTLE people, and will accomplish very Little
h:
“People who belittle people, will be LITTLE people, and will accomplish very Little” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Life is the dancer and you are the dance.
h:
“Life is the dancer and you are the dance.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
h:
“You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.
h:
“Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.” —
William Faulkner

q: Don't wait for the right opportunity: create it.
h:
“Don't wait for the right opportunity: create it.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
h:
“Let each man exercise the art he knows.” —
Aristophanes

q: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
h:
“Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.” —
John Wooden

q: On the other side of the clouds is a bright blue sky.
h:
“On the other side of the clouds is a bright blue sky.” —
Unknown

q: It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.
h:
“It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: As you love yourself, life loves you back.
h:
“As you love yourself, life loves you back.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: There is a difference between giving directions and giving direction.
h:
“There is a difference between giving directions and giving direction.” —
Simon Sinek

q: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
h:
“We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.” —
Benjamin Franklin
